messages: 7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (14:59): noss: be carefull with WYSIWYG editors, they often generate code that isn't exactly what you'd call "standards compliant".  When in doubt follow what w3 says
7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (15:00): microsoft is more important the dreamweaver and w3 is more important than both of them
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (15:01): that's mistargeted
7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (15:02): mitargeted?
7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (15:02): mistargeted?
7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (15:03): I don't know specifically, but mis = not, and targetted  = aimed
7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (15:03): not aimed?
7c7871d9e78ab3cd9457ac08ff9a1438 (15:03): aimed incorrectly?
b4043b5dbead4669ffb1b8b03787ee44 (15:06): I'm using images as links; when I add a border to it, the border only spans the lower half of the image. Any ideas to why this may be?
3f810bb342e0c1d66ae886ef90b3b0c8 (15:27): is it possible to track a forum's updates if it doesn't support RSS?
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:42): which is prefered way to use css, in <style> or in <link> or in @import ?
df2e0b7c4d59e341014d2551971ceae0 (15:44): which is a better way to display tabular data, tables or <div> tags with css?
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:44): tables
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:44): <div> is NOT for tables
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:44): <table> is for tables
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:45): tmr232, see http://www.hotdesign.com/seybold/everything.html
df2e0b7c4d59e341014d2551971ceae0 (15:45): smallfoot- use @import in a <style> tag, so only css browsers will see it and it will only be in one file
df2e0b7c4d59e341014d2551971ceae0 (15:46): smallfoot- I read it, but <div> tags are more controlled than tables
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:46): tmr232, but table is for tables, you shouldnt use div for tabular data
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:47): using tables for design (such as non tabular data) is bad
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:47): but use tables for tabular data is good
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:47): and <th> is for the header column, not <tD
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:48): <td> for the tabular data, but <th> for header row
df2e0b7c4d59e341014d2551971ceae0 (15:49): is it really important?
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:50): well, you could use <td> for all, but using a <th> is more semantic, and cleaner
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (15:51): and then you dont have to make a class for the row as you did if you used <td> but wanted it different
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (16:01): th/td is quite irrelevant.
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (16:03): and by that i mean, the scope attribute is your friend
df2e0b7c4d59e341014d2551971ceae0 (16:07): noss , how do I use the scope attribute, what dose it do?
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (16:08): it is in html 4.01
28b758a09ea8d35984b5319eb643b6c5 (16:25): Hi, I was wondering, is it possible to use an external document as a source of HTML? for when I have lots of pages that use the same piece?
28b758a09ea8d35984b5319eb643b6c5 (16:25): It would save me a lot of trouble.
28b758a09ea8d35984b5319eb643b6c5 (16:25): I'm sure there is a way, but I don't know what start
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (16:26): use server side dynamic pages that include the repetive code.
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:27): use CSS
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:28): but yeah, using server-side dynamic pages are good too
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (16:28): especially as css cant do it.
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:28): such as PHP, and include();
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:28): ya, but CSS separate alot
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:29): then there are still some html of course, those can go in footer.html and header.html and then use include(); in php
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:29): such as <?php include("header.html"); ?>

43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:53): isnt 'screen' and 'projection' the same in the <link media=""> attribute ?
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:53): and if i dont have any media="" attribute, then which is the default?
df2e0b7c4d59e341014d2551971ceae0 (16:54): what method is better? table or <div> tags?
e7918caaffdd9b4e68c1755ee6e14ada (16:54): slightly O/T, but I want to post a text file with sample html code, but the server processes it as html.  How can I force it to be rendered as plaintext?
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:55): tmr232, for tabular data it is <table>, for page layout and design it is <div>
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:56): <table> for page layout and design is discouraged and should not be used, <table> for tabular data is encouraged and should be used
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:57): vi-config, rename the file from sample.html to sample.txt
e7918caaffdd9b4e68c1755ee6e14ada (16:57): it is
e7918caaffdd9b4e68c1755ee6e14ada (16:57): with Unix line breaks and no saved state
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:57): vi-config, or if you use a scripting language such as PHP, use <?php header("Content-Type: plain/text"); ?>
e7918caaffdd9b4e68c1755ee6e14ada (16:58): ah, I think that will work
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:58): IE is a pretty dumb browser, its stubborn, it always try parse HTML from anything, jpg, txt, etc :P
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (16:58): firefox is good though
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:00): rel="" and rev="" is little tricky.. it seems quite similiar...
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:07): is <legend> deprecated?
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (17:10): html 4.01 is the most recent html edition. find it, read it, it has answers to those questions
14e15e5c671a528dcdd010fd7da15651 (17:10): smallfoot-: is <legend> deprecated?
14e15e5c671a528dcdd010fd7da15651 (17:10): http://validator.w3.org
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:15): isnt xhtml 1.1 the most recent?
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (17:16): xhtml != html
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:17): xhtml = html + xml
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:19): ok then you tell me
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:20): xhtml is a subset of html in xml? :D
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (17:20): html and xhtml are different trails. there is no one making the other deprecated.
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:23): i thought html was deprecated
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:23): when was it last updated?
43b7b1d17e7bccae2e274792fd3e606f (17:23): and that xhtml is better than html
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (17:33): yah, that can happen, most people using xhtml believe it to be so.
